awd_titl_txt: Microbial Exchanges and Couplings in Coastal Atlantic       Systems:  Biological Program
awd_abstract_narration: This is a one year renewal of a large three year                           interdisciplinary field study of the Chesapeake Bay and                         adjoining coastal area.  During the initial funding period,                     four scientific cruises in this study area collected a                          wealth of data on the nutrient recycling and microbiology                       of this coupled estuarine - coastal system.  This work                          offers the most detailed picture yet of the role of marine                      bacteria and phytoplankton in the assimilative capacity of                      coastal region impacted by large population centers.  This                      renewal will allow the collaborative scientists to add                          additional results to their existing base, and produce                          scientific publications integrating this novel collection                       of measurements in the coastal environment.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
